rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-CITIES;6004a600.1502">   <title>BSA Sport Study Group Day Conference: Sport and Social Protest </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-CITIES;6004a600.1502</link>   <description> *** APOLOGIES FOR CROSS POSTING ***<br><br>We are delighted to inform you of the forthcoming BSA Sport Study Group Day Conference: Sport and Social Protest on 15th May 2015 at the British Library Conference Centre, London.<br><br>The one-day conference has a fascinating programme in place exploring the connection between protest movements and sport. Peter Hain MP will open the conference with a keynote address on the anti-apartheid movement. The full programme&lt;http://www.britsoc.co.uk/media/80881/bsa_sport_and_social_protest_outline_programme_-_15th_january_2015_docx.pdf?1421940240197&gt; is now available on the BSA website.<br>The conference will also include the following presentations and discussions: [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-13T10:07:53+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>BSA Events Team</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-CITIES;6004a600.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-CITIES;c229ba34.1502">   <title>Booking Extended: BSA Citizenship Study Group Launch Event: Citizenship in the European Union </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-CITIES;c229ba34.1502</link>   <description> Dear All,<br>We're pleased to announce that the BSA has re-opened the booking for our launch event of the BSA Citizenship Study Group: Citizenship in the European Union. The event will be hosted on Monday the 16th of February at the BSA Meeting Room in London. Early bookings are recommended, however, as there will be a limited amount of places available. The direct link to the booking is: http://portal.britsoc.co.uk/public/event/eventBooking.aspx?id=EVT10408 [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-10T11:16:28+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Kristoffer Halvorsrud</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-CITIES;c229ba34.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-CITIES;6d4d40f2.1502">   <title>BSA Citizenship Study Group Launch Event: Citizenship in the EU </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-CITIES;6d4d40f2.1502</link>   <description> Dear All,<br><br>Apologies for cross-posting.<br><br>The BSA Citizenship Study Group is delighted to announce that the booking for our launch event ('Citizenship in the European Union') can be accessed on the following link: http://portal.britsoc.co.uk/public/event/eventBooking.aspx?id=EVT10408<br><br>Please find further infomation on the event on the attached flyer and below. Please circulate this information widely to your academic networks and to anyone who might be interested in this event. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-05T08:47:33+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Kristoffer Halvorsrud</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-CITIES;6d4d40f2.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-CITIES;75dda185.1501">   <title>CFP ISA RC21: Urban Enclosures: Scrutinizing the 'Purified' City (27-28 August Urbino, Italy) </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-CITIES;75dda185.1501</link>   <description> Apologies for cross-posting<br><br>Dear all,<br><br>we welcome abstracts for the session on &quot;Urban Enclosures: Scrutinizing the<br>'Purified' City&quot; that we are organizing at the ISA RC21 International<br>Conference The Ideal City: between myth and reality (27-29 August, Urbino,<br>Italy). The RC21 is the Research Committee on urban sociology of the<br>International Sociological Association.<br><br>http://www.rc21.org/en/conferences/urbino2015/<br><br>Session: The Making and Unmaking of Urban Closures: Scrutinizing the<br>'Purified' City (Stream E - Contested cities) [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-07T12:52:09+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>S. Pasquetti</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-CITIES;75dda185.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-CITIES;b83cd92e.1501">   <title>Fw: Utopian Studies Society 2015 The End of the City - Call for Proposals </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-CITIES;b83cd92e.1501</link>   <description> A conference of interest, including section on 'End of the City':<br><br>The 16th International Conference of the Utopian Studies Society will be hosted by Newcastle University on 1-4 July 2015. For more information and the call for proposals, visit the conference website at:<br><br>http://conferences.ncl.ac.uk/utopianstudies/callforproposals/<br><br>Dr Adam Stock, Dr Lisa Garforth and Dr Nathaniel Coleman<br>Newcastle University<br>utopian.studies@newcastle.ac.uk.    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-07T12:12:48+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Robin Smith</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-CITIES;b83cd92e.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-CITIES;fe610b90.1412">   <title>New book on Super-Diversity </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-CITIES;fe610b90.1412</link>   <description> Dear colleagues<br><br>This new book might be of interest to some of the list members:<br><br>Susanne Wessendorf: Commonplace Diversity: Social Relations in a<br>Super-Diverse Context (Palgrave Macmillan)<br><br>Urban areas in the UK and beyond have seen significant changes in patterns<br>of immigration, leading to profound diversification. This diversification is<br>characterized by the multiplication of people of different national origins,<br>but also differentiations regarding migration histories, religions,<br>educational backgrounds, legal statuses and socio-economic backgrounds. How<br>has this diversification of diversity, also described as 'super-diversity',<br>impacted on social life on the local level? How do people get along in a<br>context where [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-02T15:00:06-00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Susanne Wessendorf</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-CITIES;fe610b90.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-CITIES;cc844004.1411">   <title>Urban Geography Research Group - Call for session proposals RGS-IBG 2015 (Exeter) </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-CITIES;cc844004.1411</link>   <description> Apologies for x-posting...<br>RGS-IBG Annual International Conference 2015<br>&gt;&gt; C A L L F O R S E S S I O N S<br>The Urban Geography Research Group (UGRG) is pleased to announce that the call for sessions for the 2015 RGS-IBG Annual International Conference is now open. The conference will be chaired by Professor Sarah Whatmore (University of Oxford) and has 'Geographies of the Anthropocene' as its theme. The conference will be held at the University of Exeter, on Wednesday 2 to Friday 4 September (with an opening reception on Tuesday 1 Sep). Further info is available at: [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-21T12:05:27+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Silvestre, Gabriel</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-CITIES;cc844004.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-CITIES;90f0af82.1411">   <title>Final reminder- UGRG critical infrastructures conference- this week </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-CITIES;90f0af82.1411</link>   <description> With apologies for crossposts. This year's annual UGRG conference on<br>Critical Geographies of Urban Infrastructure is to take place on Thursday<br>(6th) and Friday (7th) of this week at the Bartlett, UCL (London).<br>Confirmed keynote speakers include Alan Latham, Adriana Allen and Erik<br>Swyngedouw and a full programme and book of abstracts is available at: [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-05T22:54:53+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Luke Binns</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-CITIES;90f0af82.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-CITIES;580ace06.1410">   <title>Critical Geographies/ Urban Infrastructure: UCL, next week... </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-CITIES;580ace06.1410</link>   <description> *With apologies for crossposts, the programme for the UGRG 2014 conference<br>is now available online. Taking place on Thursday (6th) and Friday (7th) of<br>next week at the Bartlett, UCL (London), the conference theme is Critical<br>Geographies of Urban Infrastructure and confirmed keynote speakers include<br>Alan Latham, Adriana Allen and Erik Swyngedouwe*.<br><br>*A full programme and book of abstracts is available at: * [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-31T08:43:53+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Luke Binns</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-CITIES;580ace06.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-CITIES;d49436d4.1410">   <title>Housing - Critical Futures - Inaugural Call </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-CITIES;d49436d4.1410</link>   <description> Housing \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Critical Futures \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd an international program of conferences and events is launched for 2015-16.<br>AN OPEN CALL for two Inaugural Events:<br><br>CONFERENCE \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd OPEN CALL: http://architecturemps.com/housing-critical-perspective/ 08-09 April 2015<br><br>FILM SCREENINGS &amp; DEBATE: http://architecturemps.com/h-cfl-filmdebate/ 10 January 2015<br><br>EVENTS involve:<br><br>Patrick Keiler. Independent Filmmaker. Dilapidated Dwelling \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd film screening.<br>Avi Friedman. Architect / Housing Specialist. TBC. McGill University, Canada.<br>Loretta Lees. Human Geographer. University of Leicester<br>Luciana Berger, MP. Shadow Minister for Public Health, UK. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-29T17:24:43+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>James Matthews</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-CITIES;d49436d4.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-CITIES;8d01a999.1410">   <title>Housing \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Critical Futures - OPEN CALL</title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-CITIES;8d01a999.1410</link>   <description> Here is an OPEN CALL for two Inaugural Events for Housing \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Critical Futures \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd an international program of conferences and events for 2015-16.<br><br>CONFERENCE \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd OPEN CALL: http://architecturemps.com/housing-critical-perspective/ 08-09 April 2015<br><br>FILM SCREENINGS &amp; DEBATE: http://architecturemps.com/h-cfl-filmdebate/ 10 January 2015<br><br>EVENTS involve:<br><br>Patrick Keiler. Independent Filmmaker. Dilapidated Dwelling \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd film screening.<br>Avi Friedman. Architect / Housing Specialist. TBC. McGill University, Canada.<br>Loretta Lees. Human Geographer. University of Leicester<br>Luciana Berger, MP. Shadow Minister for Public Health, UK. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-29T17:14:25+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Manfred Isaac</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-CITIES;8d01a999.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-CITIES;2848cf13.1409">   <title>FINAL CFP: CRITICAL GEOGRAPHY/ URBAN INFRASTRUCTURE Conference, abstract submission deadline tomorrow </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-CITIES;2848cf13.1409</link>   <description> *With apologies for crossposting- the Urban Geography Research Group<br>(RGS-IBG) invites papers and proposals for the upcoming conference** in<br>November 2014. **Professor Erik Swyngedouwe (Manchester) is confirmed as a<br>keynote, UCL/ Bartlett (London) is the venue, and the deadline for<br>submissions is tomorrow 19 September. See below for further details*<br>*: *<br><br>*CRITICAL GEOGRAPHIES OF URBAN INFRASTRUCTURE* [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-09-18T13:06:29+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Luke Binns</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-CITIES;2848cf13.1409</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-CITIES;f8074111.1409">   <title>Global Rome: Changing Faces of the Eternal City </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-CITIES;f8074111.1409</link>   <description> [Description: Description: Description: Description: \\\\capbiz02\\images\\covers\\large\\9780253012951_FChigh.jpg]&lt;http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/global-rome&gt;Global Rome&lt;http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/global-rome&gt;<br><br>Changing Faces of the Eternal City&lt;http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/global-rome&gt;<br>Edited by Isabella Clough Marinaro &amp; Bj\ufffd\ufffdrn Thomassen<br><br>&quot;[I]nnovative.... [T]here is no equivalent book currently available in any language.... [W]ill lend itself to semester-length courses on Rome as an 'urban laboratory.'&quot; -John Agnew, University of California, Los Angeles<br><br>Is 21st-century Rome a global city? Is it part of Europe's core or periphery? This volume examines the "real city" beyond Rome's historical center, exploring the diversity and challenges of life in neighborhoods affected by immigration, neoliberalism, formal urban planning, and grassroots social movements. The contributors engage with themes of [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-09-05T13:14:59+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Charles Woodhead</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-CITIES;f8074111.1409</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-CITIES;ea08e71a.1409">   <title>CFP- EXTENDED DEADLINE: CRITICAL GEOGRAPHIES OF URBAN INFRASTRUCTURE, Nov 2014, London </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-CITIES;ea08e71a.1409</link>   <description> *The Urban Geography Research Group (RGS-IBG) invites papers and proposals<br>for its upcoming annual conference in November 2014, London. The deadline<br>for submissions has been extended to 19 September. See below for details*<br>*: *<br><br>*CRITICAL GEOGRAPHIES OF URBAN INFRASTRUCTURE*<br><br>A two-day conference and open discussion organised by the Urban Geography<br>Research Group (UGRG) of the RGS-IBG. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-09-01T10:12:13+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Luke Binns</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-CITIES;ea08e71a.1409</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-CITIES;c23e6d07.1408">   <title>CFP: CRITICAL GEOGRAPHIES OF URBAN INFRASTRUCTURE Conference, Nov 2014, London </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-CITIES;c23e6d07.1408</link>   <description> *The Urban Geography Research Group (RGS-IBG) invites papers and proposals<br>for its upcoming annual conference- November 5-6, London. Please see below<br>for details*<br>*:*<br><br>*CRITICAL GEOGRAPHIES OF URBAN INFRASTRUCTURE*<br><br>A two-day conference and open discussion organised by the Urban Geography<br>Research Group (UGRG) of the RGS-IBG.<br><br>6-7 November 2014 The Bartlett School of Planning, University College<br>London<br><br>Call for Contributions [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-08-14T12:48:37+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Luke Binns</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-CITIES;c23e6d07.1408</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-CITIES;91079c71.1408">   <title>CfP UGRG Conference 2014 - Critical Geographies of Urban Infrastructure </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-CITIES;91079c71.1408</link>   <description> \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdApologies for the multiple postings...<br><br>2nd Call for papers<br><br>CRITICAL GEOGRAPHIES OF URBAN INFRASTRUCTURE<br><br>A two-day conference and open discussion organised by the Urban Geography Research Group (UGRG) of the RGS-IBG (urban-geography.org.uk&lt;http://urban-geography.org.uk&gt;).<br><br>Dates: 6-7 November 2014<br>Location: University College London, the Bartlett School of Planning<br><br>Preliminary Call for Contributions<br><br>This year\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds UGRG Conference will explore the relationship between critical urban theory and infrastructure. Critical urbanism may be defined by Brenner et al (2009: 179) as concerned: [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-08-05T11:24:48+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Silvestre, Gabriel</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-CITIES;91079c71.1408</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-CITIES;9f5b1a71.1406">   <title>CfP UGRG Conference 2014 - Critical Geographies of Urban Infrastructure </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-CITIES;9f5b1a71.1406</link>   <description> Apologies for cross-posting...<br><br>CRITICAL GEOGRAPHIES OF URBAN INFRASTRUCTURE<br><br>A two-day conference and open discussion organised by the Urban Geography Research Group (UGRG) of the RGS-IBG.<br><br>Dates: 6-7 November 2014<br>Location: University College London, the Bartlett School of Planning<br><br>Preliminary Call for Contributions<br><br>This year’s UGRG Conference will explore the relationship between critical urban theory and infrastructure. Critical urbanism may be defined by Brenner et al (2009: 179) as concerned: [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-06-27T11:38:35+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Silvestre, Gabriel</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-CITIES;9f5b1a71.1406</dc:identifier> </item>   </rdf:RDF>
